metro.GameScreen.LineView

Class LineView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • metro.GameScreen.GameScreen
        • metro.GameScreen.LineView.LineView

  • public class LineView
extends GameScreen
    The LineView is a dialog to manage the train lines in METRO. It allows the user to create, modify and remove lines.
    Author:
    hauke

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class metro.GameScreen.GameScreen

      • LineView

        public LineView()
        Creates a new TrainLineView.

    • Method Detail

      • addCreateLineButtonObserver

        private void addCreateLineButtonObserver()
        Creates the action listener for the "Create line"-Button. This will unlock/lock all necessary controls.

      • addEditButtonObserver

        private void addEditButtonObserver()
        Creates the listener for the edit button. Fills controls with information about line so that the player can edit it.

      • addRemoveLineButtonObserver

        private void addRemoveLineButtonObserver()
        Create the action observer for the "Remove line"-button. This will remove the whole selected line.

      • addSaveButtonObserver

        private void addSaveButtonObserver()
        Create the action observer for the "Save"-button Creates a new train line and saves it correctly. If something went wrong, an error message will be shown.

      • addColorBarObserver

        private void addColorBarObserver()
        Creates the observer for the color bar. The observer will manage the click and update operations.

      • addMessageLabelObserver

        private void addMessageLabelObserver()
        Creates an observer for the message label. When a user clicks this label, the text will be removed.

      • updateGameScreen

      • setVisibility

        public void setVisibility(boolean visible)
        Sets the visibility of the TrainLineView. The visibility will also effect the usability (e.g. mouse click).
        Parameters:
        visible - True will make this visible, false will make it invisible.

      • hasControlClicked

        Checks if a control has been clicked since last call.
        Returns:
